prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stafford County (Va.) Court Records, 1664-1793 (bulk 1686-1693), Local governement records collection, Stafford County Court Records.The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Stafford County. Order Book, 1664-1668; 1689-1693, was created under Accession number 21938.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Stafford County was formed from Westmoreland County in 1664. Part of King George County was added on 1 January 1777. The county is named for the English county.
These court records were originally created by the County Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Stafford County (Va.) Court Records, 1664-1793 (bulk 1686-1693) includes an Order Book, a Clerk's Order Book and a Scheme Book L-D. An order book is the formal, corrected transcription of the clerk's notes of the proceedings of court. From the records-keeping point of view, the county clerk has always been the most important local official.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Clerk Record Book, 1051103 and Scheme Book L-D, 1112971 are found at the State Records Center. Contact Archives Research Services for access information, directions and hours.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Stafford County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Stafford County is one of Virginia's Lost Record Localities. Additional Stafford County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Record Localities Database found on the Library of Virginia's web site.
